0.text: Innate - Mini Gnar: While in Mini Gnar form, Gnar gains  bonus movement speed,  bonus attack range,  attack speed, as well as attack speed growth.

1.text: Innate - Rage Gene:  Mini Gnar generates 4 / 7 / 11 (based on level)  Rage over 2 seconds upon dealing or receiving damage. Against non-champions, basic attacks and  Boomerang Throw instantly generate「 0.5 / 0.875 / 1.375 (based on level) Rage. 」「 12.5% of the amount. 」 Against champions,  Boomerang Throw instantly generates「 1 / 1.75 / 2.75 (based on level) Rage, 」「 25% of the amount, 」and basic attacks instantly generate「 2 / 3.5 / 5.5 (based on level). 」「 50% of the amount. 」 Boomerang Throw can only generate Rage once per cast, and grants Rage based on the first enemy hit. Gnar's Rage decays if he has not dealt or taken damage in the last 13 seconds.

2.text:
Within 4 seconds after reaching maximum Rage, Gnar's abilities become  Mega Gnar's, which will transform Gnar into  Mega Gnar upon cast. He will also transform after the duration has passed.
 Mega Gnar form lasts for 15 seconds, during which Gnar's Rage depletes. Afterwards, Gnar returns to  Mini Gnar, retaining his  current percentage health and becoming too  tired to generate Rage for 15 seconds.

3.text: Innate - Mega Gnar: Mega Gnar has different abilities, although they share Mini Gnar's ability cooldowns. While in Mega Gnar form, Gnar loses all of Mini Gnar's buffs and instead has increased  base AD,  base health,  base armor, and  base magic resistance. Gnar restores  health equal to the increase.

0.text: Active: Gnar throws a boomerang in a line in the target direction that deals physical damage to enemies in its path and  slows them for 2 seconds. The boomerang returns towards Gnar in a fixed line after reaching its maximum range or hitting an enemy, dealing 50% damage to subsequent targets.

1.text: Each enemy can only be hit once. Catching the boomerang while it is returning back refunds 40% of the ability's  maximum cooldown.

0.text: Passive: Gnar's basic attacks and abilities apply a stack of Hyper to affected enemies for 3.5 seconds, stacking up to 3 times, with the duration refreshing upon applying the second stack.

1.text: Upon applying 3 stacks to a target, the stacks are consumed to deal bonus magic damage and grant Gnar 20 / 40 / 60 / 80% (based on  GNAR!'s rank)  bonus movement speed that decays over 3 seconds. The damage is capped at 300 (+ 100% AP) against  monsters.

2.text: Gnar gains Hyper's  bonus movement speed when he leaves  Mega form.

0.text: Active: Gnar  leaps to the target location, and upon arrival gains  bonus attack speed for 6 seconds.

1.text: If Gnar lands on a unit he will  bounce 500 units further in the same direction.

2.text: Landing on an enemy deals them physical damage and  slows them by 80% for 0.5 seconds.

3.text: Gnar will not bounce if he is  immobilized during the first leap.

0.text: Active: Gnar throws a boulder in the target direction that stops upon hitting an enemy, dealing physical damage to nearby enemies upon impact and  slowing them for 2 seconds. The boulder then remains on the ground for 6 seconds.

1.text: After 0.3 seconds, Gnar can pick up the boulder by moving within 90 units of it, refunding 70% of the ability's  maximum cooldown.

0.text: Active: Gnar slams his arm down in the target direction, dealing physical damage to all enemies struck within the area and  stunning them for 1.25 seconds.
Active: Gnar  leaps to the target location and deals physical damage to nearby enemies upon impact. After a 0.25-second delay, additional enemies in a larger radius also take the same damage.

1.text: If Crunch is used to transform, Gnar will still be able to  bounce as per  Hop. Crunch's area of effect is dealt in both areas, though enemies can only be damaged once.

2.text: Enemies Gnar lands directly on top of are affected by Hop's  slow.

0.text: Mini Gnar - Passive:  Hyper's  bonus movement speed is increased.

1.text: Mega Gnar - Active: Gnar thrusts his arms in the target direction,  knocking away nearby enemies up to 590 units in that direction and afterwards dealing them physical damage, as well as  slowing them by 45% after a 0.4-second delay.

2.text: Enemies that collide with terrain take  50% increased damage instantly and are  stunned instead of  slowed.

passive.originHTML:
Passive

Unique – Bloodlust: After dealing damage to or taking damage from an enemy champion, heal for ( 2% / 1.2%) of maximum health over 6 seconds. This stacks and refreshes per unique champion, up to 5 times, but every stack beyond the first is reduced by 50%, for a maximum of healing for ( 6% / 3.6%) of maximum health over the duration.
Unique – Lifeline: If you would take damage that would reduce you below 30% of your maximum health, you first gain a shield that absorbs 100 damage for 4 seconds, increased by ( 8% / 4.8%) maximum health per stack of Bloodlust, up to an increase of ( 40% / 24%) maximum health at 5 Bloodlust stacks (60 second cooldown).
passive.originText: UNIQUE – BLOODLUST: After dealing damage to or taking damage from an enemy champion,  heal for ( 2% /  1.2%) of maximum health over 6 seconds. This stacks and refreshes per unique champion, up to 5 times, but every stack beyond the first is reduced by 50%, for a maximum of healing for ( 6% /  3.6%) of maximum health over the duration.

passive.originHTML:
Passive

Unique – Bloodlust: After dealing damage to or taking damage from an enemy champion, heal for ( 2% / 1.2%) of maximum health over 6 seconds. This stacks and refreshes per unique champion, up to 5 times, but every stack beyond the first is reduced by 50%, for a maximum of healing for ( 6% / 3.6%) of maximum health over the duration.
Unique – Lifeline: If you would take damage that would reduce you below 30% of your maximum health, you first gain a shield that absorbs 100 damage for 4 seconds, increased by ( 8% / 4.8%) maximum health per stack of Bloodlust, up to an increase of ( 40% / 24%) maximum health at 5 Bloodlust stacks (60 second cooldown).
